texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: There's a few final configuration options that may help the performance of your slave MySQL servers. If you're not using certain storage engines, like InnoDB or Berkeley, then by all means, remove them from your configuration. For those two specifically, just add the following to your my.cnf on the slave server:
texts.text: There's a few final configuration options that may help the performance of your slave MySQL servers. If you're not using certain storage engines, like InnoDB or Berkeley, then by all means, remove them from your configuration. For those two specifically, just add the following to your my.cnf on the slave server:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: To reduce disk I/O on big MyISAM write operations, you can  delay the flushing of indexes  to the disk:
texts.text: To reduce disk I/O on big MyISAM write operations, you can  delay the flushing of indexes  to the disk:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You can also make all of your  write queries take a backseat  to any reads:
texts.text: You can also make all of your  write queries take a backseat  to any reads:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Keep in mind, however, that the last two options will increase slave performance, but it  may cause them to lag behind the master . Depending on your application, this may not be acceptable.
texts.text: Keep in mind, however, that the last two options will increase slave performance, but it  may cause them to lag behind the master . Depending on your application, this may not be acceptable.
